intro: Lasiandra pogonanthera, commonly known as the woolly sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lasiandra pogonanthera is often found in coastal and inland dunes, contributing to the ecological stability of these environments.
